Articles.Content:
Hi all! 

I have been working on a short film for a competition where the prize is to have your film screened to Tim Peake on board the ISS, which is pretty cool! After about four weeks of work (and more beforehand creating the spacecraft model, which was initially unrelated to the film and I have been working on since late last year) the project is finally complete. I present ATLAS, inspired in part by some of the unused concept artwork for 2001: A Space Odyssey. Hope you guys enjoy. The deadline is Monday, so any suggestions prior to that point are very welcome since there's a bit of time left to do tweaks. I used Blender 3D as well as After Effects for this project.

@benjee10  It's really amazing, I hope you win!!! My one tip is that the spacecraft looks too, I don't know, CG? maybe just a filter over it could make it look more gritty and realistic. Very slight, though.

Edited February 12, 2016 by CommanderSpock

Cheers for the comments guys!

The competition is closed now, should be getting results back before April!

Update on this: the film has been placed on the shortlist for the age category 16-19 along with four other films, from which there will be two winners whose films will be sent to be watched by Tim Peake!
